posts.post_content: Kind of obvious he was made to compliment [Blaze of Glory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blaze of Glory) at the time. Much better creature than it's contemporary [Thicket Basilisk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thicket Basilisk), and a better ability than Deathtouch, since damage isn't a factor, AND the creatures dying can't regenerate. All for W. That's a lot of power rapped up in that little guy. 4/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
My guess is that they got the idea of [Loyal Sentry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loyal Sentry) from this guy. It makes perfect sense. I remember as a kid my one of my buddies always used this card and when he got it out we would always be mad because it always eventually killed my [Jungle Wurms](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jungle Wurms) off!! haha the good old days.
  
   
PS. This card has great flavor and is a cool old school card from the early days.

posts.post_content:
I like how he was a "Leper".  
It was like he would infect the other guy but was so weak that he would die too.  
  
As said, he is very good with [lure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lure). I guess [Echo Circlet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Echo Circlet) might be a little bit useful as well... Otherwise it's a 1 mana kill.  
  
Wish I was around to play Arabian Nights.  
  
3.5/5

Posted By: Fert12334 (2/8/2011 11:08:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Heh, I remember the endless speculation at school that he was named after the characters Abu and Jafar from the Disney Aladdin movie, which came out a year before Arabian Nights.  
  
As for the creature himself, I don't have much more to add to what others have said. Flavourful, and does his role well - the question is how often, realistically, do you need a creature which performs that role? In my opinion he's better thought of as a cheap but highly situational white kill spell, or at least a deterrent against attacking, in a vaguely similar vein to something like [Spirit Link](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Link).
posts.html:
Heh, I remember the endless speculation at school that he was named after the characters Abu and Jafar from the Disney Aladdin movie, which came out a year before Arabian Nights.

As for the creature himself, I don't have much more to add to what others have said. Flavourful, and does his role well - the question is how often, realistically, do you need a creature which performs that role? In my opinion he's better thought of as a cheap but highly situational white kill spell, or at least a deterrent against attacking, in a vaguely similar vein to something like Spirit Link.

posts.post_content: It has a weak body only siting at 0/1. But I have to say it can really be usefull even later in the game as a blocker, even takes down creatures with first strike when it's defending.

Posted By: Silverware (12/4/2009 2:37:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
No Keegan, creatures are only considered "blocking"(, "attacking") or "blocked" during combat, after that step you treat them normally as if they were never involved in combat.  
I agree with the [Lure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lure) thing, yet it's some sort of deathtouching one-drop that can't harm your opponents, therefore it can also do a good job as chump-blocker à la [Dead-Iron Sledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dead-Iron Sledge) by itself. At least it's better than [Cinder Wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cinder Wall) most of the time.
posts.html:
